# Setup 

```{r}
if (!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman")
pacman::p_load(
        purrr, # for functional programming
        foreign, # for importing stata files 
        tidyverse, # for the tidyverse framework 
        psych, # for psych tools  
        ggthemes, # for fancy ggplot themes
        here, # for self-contained projects
        ggpubr, # for pub-ready themes 
        glue, # pasting string and objects
        scales, # changing scales 
        patchwork # putting ggplots together
)

source(here("functions", "utils.r"))

# for publication-friendly theme 
theme_set(theme_pubr())
```

# Import files 

The data has 406 variables (the number of columns) and 6,448 observations (the number of rows for each column). Also, please note that the `table() function` shows that every survey participant participated in the full survey. 

```{r}
# Import 

data <- read.dta(here::here("raw_data","naas16post-weighted-recoded.dta"))

# Participation 
table(data$fullsurvey)
```

# Turn factors into numbers

```{r}
# Turn factors into numbers 
data <- data %>%
  mutate(across(where(is.factor), compose(parse_number, as.character)))

# There are 569 variables 
ncol(data) 
```

# Select and rename variables 

```{r}
# Create each dataframe
co_vars <- data %>%
    dplyr::select(
  
        # ID
        respid,     
       
        # Covariates
        male, # male 
        age, # age 
        educ6, # edu 
        ownhome, # home ownership 
        race, # race 
        democrat, # democrat
        republican, # republican
        q10_15, # income level
        pidadjweight, # survey weight (PID-adjusted, Wave 2)
        statesmp, # states 
        forborn, # foreign born 
        citizen) %>% # citizen
  rename("income" = "q10_15",
         "weight" = "pidadjweight",
         "states" = "statesmp")

mar_vars <- data %>% dplyr::select(matches("micro|discrim")) %>%
    select(-contains("index")) %>%
    select(-contains("worship"))

linked_vars <- data %>% dplyr::select(matches("linked"))

comm_vars <- data %>% dplyr::select(commrace, commcult, commecon, commpol)

# DV 

dv_vars <- data %>%
    dplyr::select(q3_6_a, q3_6_b, q3_6_c, q3_6_d, q3_6_f, q3_6_g) %>%
    rename("inequality" = "q3_6_a",
         "bank_reg" = "q3_6_b",
         "minimum_wage" = "q3_6_c",
         "rich_tax" = "q3_6_d",
         "american_job" = "q3_6_f",
         "free_college" = "q3_6_g")

eq_vars <- data %>%
    dplyr::select(eq_oppty, eq_toofar, eq_chance, eq_worryless, eq_notproblem, eq_fewerprobs)

ethnic_vars <- data %>%
    dplyr::select(chinese, filipino, indian, japanese, korean, vietnamese,
                  cambodian, hmong, bangladeshi, pakistani, hawaiian)

challeng_vars <- data %>%
    dplyr::select(starts_with("challeng_"))

# Import identity importance from raw data (recoded imp_* vars are buggy â€” all identical)
raw <- read.dta(here::here("raw_data", "NAAS-16post-finalraw.dta"))
imp_vars <- raw %>%
    mutate(across(where(is.factor), compose(parse_number, as.character))) %>%
    dplyr::select(respid, q4_2a, q4_2b, q4_2c, q4_2d) %>%
    rename("imp_raceid" = "q4_2a", "imp_ethnicid" = "q4_2b",
           "imp_genderid" = "q4_2c", "imp_nationid" = "q4_2d")

# Bind them together
df <- bind_cols(co_vars, mar_vars, linked_vars, comm_vars, dv_vars,
                eq_vars, ethnic_vars, challeng_vars)

# Merge identity importance by respid
df <- df %>% left_join(imp_vars, by = "respid")

# Inspect
glimpse(df)
```

# Recode values 

## Some variables better treated as factors 

Some variables are better treated as factors because they are categorical variables (e.g., race). 

```{r}
# Race
df$race <- df$race %>%
    as.character() %>%
    recode("1" = "AAPI",  # Originally Asian Americans 
           "2" = "AAPI",  # Originally Pacific Islanders
           "3" = "White",
           "4" = "Black",
           "5" = "Black", # Originally African American
           "6" = "Latino",
           "9" = "Multiracial") %>%
    as.factor()

df <- df %>%
  mutate(race = as.factor(race),
         democrat = as.factor(democrat),
         republican = as.factor(republican),
         states = as.factor(states),
         forborn = as.factor(forborn),
         citizen = as.factor(citizen))
```

## Replace non-response values (`88`, `99`, `8888`, `9999`) with `NA`s

```{r}
non_response_vals <- c(88, 99, 8888, 9999)
df <- df %>%
  mutate(across(where(is.numeric), ~ {
    x <- .x
    for (v in non_response_vals) x <- dplyr::na_if(x, v)
    x
  }))

glue("What's the percentage of missing values in the data AFTER replacing non-reponse values with NAs?: {(mean(is.na(df)) %>% round(2)) * 100}%")
```

## Fix branching logic (structural missingness)

Q4.4 (`linkedfate_ethnic`) is only asked of Asian and Latino respondents. Q4.2b (`imp_ethnicid`) is only asked of Asian and Latino respondents. Non-eligible groups have structural `0`s that should be `NA`.

```{r}
df <- df %>%
  mutate(
    linkedfate_ethnic = if_else(race %in% c("AAPI", "Latino"), linkedfate_ethnic, NA_real_),
    imp_ethnicid = if_else(race %in% c("AAPI", "Latino"), imp_ethnicid, NA_real_)
  )
```

## Reverse values 

```{r}
df$inequality <- 6 - df$inequality
df$bank_reg <- 6 - df$bank_reg
df$minimum_wage <- 6 - df$minimum_wage
df$rich_tax <- 6 - df$rich_tax
df$free_college <- 6 - df$free_college

# Reverse-code anti-egalitarian equality items (higher = more egalitarian)
df$eq_toofar <- 6 - df$eq_toofar
df$eq_worryless <- 6 - df$eq_worryless
df$eq_notproblem <- 6 - df$eq_notproblem
```

## Rescale responses 

Rescale ordinal responses on the same scale (0-1).

```{r}
# Re-scale ordinal responses
rescaled <- df %>%
  dplyr::select(where(is.numeric), -weight) %>% # keep survey weight on original scale
  apply(2, scales::rescale) %>%
  as.data.frame() 
```

```{r}
combined <- bind_cols(rescaled, df %>% select(respid, where(is.factor), weight))

names(combined)
```

# Descriptive statistics 

```{r}
d1 <- combined %>%
  pivot_longer(matches("micro"),
               names_to = "Micro",
               values_to = "Score") %>%
  mutate(micro_binary = if_else(Score != 0, 1, 0)) %>%
  group_by(race) %>%
  summarise(mean = mean(micro_binary, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  filter(race != "Multiracial") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = fct_reorder(race, mean), y = mean)) +
    geom_col() +
    labs(x = "Race", 
         y = "Percentage",
         title = "Micro-aggression",
         subtitle = glue("Percentage of Those Responded 'Yes' 
                         To At Least One Related Question")) +
         #caption = "Source: National Asian American Survey (2016)") +
    scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent)

d2 <- combined %>%
  pivot_longer(matches("disc"),
               names_to = "Disc",
               values_to = "Score") %>%
  mutate(disc_binary = if_else(Score != 0, 1, 0)) %>%
  group_by(race) %>%
  summarise(mean = mean(disc_binary, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  filter(race != "Multiracial") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = fct_reorder(race, mean), y = mean)) +
    geom_col() +
    labs(x = "Race", 
         y = "",
         title = "Discrimination",
         subtitle = glue("Percentage of Those Responded 'Yes' 
                         To At Least One Related Question"),
         caption = "Source: National Asian American Survey (2016)"
         ) +
    scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent)

d1 + d2
ggsave(here("outputs", "desc_comp.png"), width = 8)
```

# Save the cleaned file 

```{r}
write.csv(combined, here("processed_data/cleaned.csv"))
```
